revised_title: Elastic Constants of Fused Quartz: Temperature Dependence of Young's Modulus
tldr: This article investigates the change in Young's modulus of fused quartz as the temperature increases. The author finds that the modulus increases continuously from room temperature to temperatures above 600°C. The experiments reveal that the material properties of fused quartz are affected by temperature, with the modulus increasing rapidly at lower temperatures and then stabilizing at higher temperatures.
